item.title: Re: On _nomap and _optout: Very helpful information i wish to read more it here... https://www.gbwapp.co/ -namalumfard
Re: 20 years ago...: Does this mean we're starting to become old farts? ;-) -ccie4526
Re: Pixel update RQ3A.210905.001 breaks GPS: I downloaded the latest Wigle update and the problem appears to be fixed - thank you! -ecramp

Re: Pixel update RQ3A.210905.001 breaks GPS: Of course I came here after I installed the update and ran into the issue. ‚òπÔ∏è I also found that I had to turn off the Wi-Fi scan throttling developer option again after the update. I'm happy to try gathering debug data of that would help. -scarhill

Pixel update RQ3A.210905.001 breaks GPS: GPS no longer updates when the device is locked after upgrading Pixel devices to RQ3A.210905.001. (Android 11 September). Beware, upgrades will render your devices unusable for stumbling. We are researching options. -arkasha
Re: 20 years ago...: I don't even believe in networks! :) -SkywardLark

Re: 20 years ago...: Wow, how many sites have been around for 20 years!!! Great job guys. I've been uploading files since February of 2004 and will keep them coming in the future as well. Thanks!!! ü§ì -AZ_WD'er
Re: On _nomap and _optout: Hm. I wish we had a button for reporting spam. üôä -kurz
Re: 20 years ago...: So.Many.Dots. It's been a fun ride/drive/boat/walk, here's to 20 more! -pejacoby
Re: 20 years ago...: This whole thing is pretty shocking. -bobzilla
Re: 20 years ago...: Congratulations! Thank you Wigle team for all you have done! I hope there are many years to follow. -grim0us
Re: 20 years ago...: Happy birthday to all you collaborative wireless surveyors & researchers! üéÇ ü•≥ üéâ üç∞ -kurz

20 years ago...: ...bobzilla put the first WiGLE upload form online. An unlikely and remarkable series of events ensued and WiGLE.net has grown, evolved, and thrived for 20 years as of today. -arkasha

Re: WiGLE on Motorola DROID: Woodster wrote: > I'm using WiGLEWiFi for Android on my Motorola DROID. Sometimes it works > great and other times it seems not to pick up any networks between my start > and finish points. Any ideas? other WiFi's might have been in place for longer than yours, and have been mapped by someone before you arrive ? -showline
